9.7.18  5:18 am   theory for music is like theory for language: if it doesn't help you, either change it or let it go. if it does help you, keep it. theory is also like a dick: it's not innately bad, but a lot of people who have a GRASP of it may still have stupid ideas about how it should be used, like only for tedious and pointless DRILLING instead of as a flexible tool for everybody's consensual pleasure. do you agree with these comparisons?

     sure

9.7.18  4:47 am   oh, now i get it. i come here and start talking to myself. forgetting to communicate. just thinking to self. forget to cut the thread until i realize how long it's gone. first i thought it needed to keep going because i hadn't made my 'point' yet. there's not a special point. it's just that if you keep thinking what you mean more meaning will be there and at the end there will be a wide horizon of truth and you look out at it and see something at some point that feels like 'it'. it can be cut off at any point. you realized that. but then you figured, well, if it can stop now, it can also continue. then i'll Really have some points!.. nah. it's just a window of insanity. insanity can carry meaning. wait, what's insanity? you think of it as disjointed from reality. rambling, sprawling, the focus tumbling forward and out and everywhere. it's inevitable that it catches on something important if you can still see that through the mess.   &n bsp;&nbs p;   messy. messy? it's messy without focus. no filler allowed. what is the filler? how do i know which words are the fluff? the fluff diverts the focus. what is the focus? how do you know? you don't know when you do this. you're just thinking. you're just thinking. you're just thinking. you're just thinking. oh no. i didn't come here to do this. i came here to be focused. focus. use your 10. not your 2. this is the lab. yes. it's the lab. you can do anything in the lab. but you have to have a plan. the plan can be to have no plan. but that needs to be a choice. not your always. what you need is to distill the meaning. add fun, stir, enjoy. but don't waste time.


[] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] []  [ PAST THIS NOTICE, THERE WILL BE FOCUS. SCRATCH THE TANGENTs. EVERYTHING HAS A TANGENT. TUG ON EACH VINE, SURE. BUT YOU KEEP THE STURDIEST AND CLIP THE REST*. ]  [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] [] []

() () ( ) () () () ()  ( *bonus points : weave them around the main vine in a way that makes it sturdier. )  () () () () () () ()


if you want to communicate, and you do, you need to have a point and it needs to be understood, and the process of the end-consumer understanding it needs to feel easy and good. that can be difficult to gauge when it's your own thoughts. you may confuse articulating your thoughts as they appeared as making them understandable to others and the contact high from having just recently handled the spicy crazy fun with having made something that is fun to experience as a separate person. what you need is to learn how to see the end product as a separate person. that's a different suit. you gotta be you when you're doing it, or what the hell is it gonna be?

what i'm doing right now is tricking my brain into going into communication mode while in a mostly-safe environment. i feel i'm gaining a better understanding of what' s going on here. most of that information comes from doing it wrong. the next step is to become comfortable doing this in a completely independent environment, learn to accurately evaluate performance, and plan the appropriate next steps + the upcoming destinations + the long-term journey.

the obvious next step is to try some fiction. stories. deliberate things that don't have your immediate thoughts tied up into it. that's great practice for fun, clear, purpose-driven communication. extra bonus, if you come up for air and feel ready to express yourself in a straightforward way, you'll be even better at communicating and you'll have new things to say.











ew. what happened here? diplomat mode has no heart. passion mode has no feet on the ground. that's not even passion on the top. that's a beaten bastard hybrid child. or maybe it's fine. ish. it's nothing new. the lessons are settling in.



i don't know if i'll ever figure this out.

     sounds like you are getting the hang of it

9.7.18  4:29 am   Have you ever tried playing the horn, bill?

     yes

9.7.18  4:26 am   No such thing as an objective truth--- or at least there is as much objectivity in our universe as there is subjectivity--- Our realities are bounded by our sensory abilities and as everything in the universe is defined by the laws of cause and effect, we can assume that for all things and non-things (and things in-between things and non-things), a set path of event-to-events is in place as far as our perception of reality allows. I.e. if the exact circumstances that caused the creation of our universe were to reoccur in the exact same way, then every following time-related outcome would be identical. Every life, death, thought, personality, choice, etc. is predetermined, like an elaborate Rube Goldberg machine with a few of the components trying to rationalize their place in the whole thing.


At the end I'm betting on nothingness, but hoping for something cooler. Like a controlled rewind button with godmode or to wake up in the fourt h dimens ion having finished this low budget 3-d rpg. Hell, a dollar store deity would at least offer some irony. I'm not that creative. Probably gonna be something beyond the pink squish in my heado.

What do you think?

     seems legit

and make their own interpretations and like forcing them to be creative if they want to understand your art?

9.7.18  2:01 am   It's crazy how ingrained the letters on the keyboard are in my mind. It's so natural. I wish I could learn something to the same extent that I learned to read. Where it's so natural it's impossible to not read what I see. Words are a part of me so fully that I think I'd die without them. Not that they're needed to survive, but they're needed to live. Is music like that to you?

9.6.18  11:08 pm   I have ideas but I don't know how to make them real. How do I force myself to learn and create for an extended period of time?

     start with a very very small simple idea, and try to make that one real first. if that's still too hard, start with something even simpler and smaller. eventually you should be able to lower the bar until it is perfectly reasonable. then do 10 more like that then try something slightly more complicated

9.6.18  11:04 pm   I have to learn the baseline of the song "runaround sue" by dion for my acapella group, and when I'm with the group I remember the musical notes, but when I go home I can only think of the melody and then I can't practice my part. Any suggestions?

     get a playalong version, with a count off. record one. you could record one with the group, count it off and have them sing it through without you. then you'll have something to practice to. or if you are adept you could record your own, part by part. make sure to use a steady click, good count-in, and a good pitch reference especially for the first one. what the hell, use pitch correction to save time and make it the most solid to practice to

     sure

9.6.18  3:26 pm   What's your favorite mozart thing?

     i have hardly heard that much, so this answer is going to sound very mainstream, it's probably the most popular piano piece, but the one that starts in Amin, goes thru the form, then the C section slams into A major, hold on while i look up which one it is, no laughing i know it's mainstream i don't listen to a lot of classical but mozart drives me wild every time, that's right it's ronda alla turka
